abstract: Japanese information-technology services company NTT Data will buy a United States company, Keane, for more than 100 billion yen ($1.2 billion) as it looks to make a push into the world’s biggest I.T. market, the Nikkei business daily said on Thursday, according to Reuters.
snippet: Japanese information-technology services company NTT Data will buy a United States company, Keane, for more than 100 billion yen ($1.2 billion) as it looks to make a push into the world’s biggest I.T. market, the Nikkei business daily said on Thur...
lead_paragraph: NTT Data, an information technology company in Japan, plans to buy Boston-based Keane Inc., a computing services company, for more than 100 billion yen ($1.2 billion) as it looks to make a push into the world’s biggest I.T. market, the Nikkei business daily said on Thursday, according to Reuters.

headline.main: Japan’s NTT Data Is Reported to Buy Keane Inc.
